p: C. winterianus extracts have shown repellency and substantial control capacity against many species from different insect orders, such as Spodoptera exigua HÃ¼bner (Lepidoptera: Noctuidae) [ 30, 31], Anopheles gambiae (Insecta: Culicidae) [ 32], and Callosobruchus maculatus Fabricius (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Bruchinae) [ 33], the former being an important stored product pest. On the other hand, O. basilicum has confronted several storage pests, such as Sithopilus zeamais Motschulsky (Coleoptera: Curculionidae) [ 34] and Rhyzoperta dominica Fabricius (Coleoptera: Bostrichidae) [ 35], but does not show insecticidal activity against Coleoptera, a species belonging to other insect orders, such as S. exigua [ 31].
